description: Indicates direct conflicts between case holdings, either within the same jurisdiction or across jurisdictions, requiring resolution by higher authority

issue.description: Specific legal issue or holding that is in conflict
examples: Whether preventive detention requires judicial review within 24 hours
Interpretation of 'reasonable restriction' on free speech
Scope of parliamentary privilege in defamation suits

resolution.description: How the conflict was resolved, if applicable
examples: Resolved by Supreme Court en banc decision

resolution_case_id.description: Case ID that resolved the conflict

conflict_severity.description: Severity of the conflict for legal certainty

same_jurisdiction.description: Whether conflict is within the same jurisdiction

binding_hierarchy.description: Which case takes precedence based on court hierarchy

notes.description: Additional context, scholarly analysis, or pending resolution details

indexes: CREATE INDEX conflicts_status IF NOT EXISTS FOR ()-[r:CONFLICTS_WITH]-() ON (r.resolution_status)
CREATE INDEX conflicts_severity IF NOT EXISTS FOR ()-[r:CONFLICTS_WITH]-() ON (r.conflict_severity)
CREATE INDEX conflicts_type IF NOT EXISTS FOR ()-[r:CONFLICTS_WITH]-() ON (r.conflict_type)
CREATE INDEX conflicts_jurisdiction IF NOT EXISTS FOR ()-[r:CONFLICTS_WITH]-() ON (r.same_jurisdiction)

examples.description: Conflict between two High Court decisions on bail provisions

properties.issue: Whether non-bailable offense accused can be granted bail before trial based on delay in proceedings
properties.resolution: Resolved by Supreme Court holding that delay beyond reasonable time warrants bail consideration even in non-bailable offenses
properties.binding_hierarchy: Equal level - needed Supreme Court resolution
properties.notes: Created legal uncertainty for 8 months until Supreme Court clarified the position

examples.description: Unresolved inter-jurisdictional conflict on privacy rights

properties.issue: Whether right to privacy extends to protection of biometric data collected by state
properties.binding_hierarchy: Different jurisdictions - no formal precedential relationship
properties.notes: Bangladesh SC took narrower view of data privacy rights compared to Indian SC's expansive interpretation
